intro: Daviesia major, commonly known as the yellow hill myrtle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, yellowish-pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences and attract a variety of pollinators. Daviesia major is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
